page.title: 04THE PROMENADE AT HORNSEA
page.content: At Hornsea{Promenade}it is not a natural cliff because there are {sea-walls}and{groynes}everywhere. It is really a{tourist area}because there are pubs, hotels and boarding houses. For children there are amusements, a BMX track, an adventure playground and a paddling pool. For adults there are dances at the Floral Hall, an open market, a bowling green, cafes and shops. On the{beach}there are over fourteen groynes. Our{line transect}measured {sand}as{85%, shingle}(<1cm){14%}and {pebbles}(1-5cm){1%.}It was{100m}to{low {water}by the 11th groyne. The{cliffs}here are{very low,}partly because it is the valley of the Stream Dike. As some of the{sea-walls}are {collapsing,}work is going on to{repair them. Victoria Laughton
